column4: Which kernel should I use to have a 64bit ubuntu version access > 4gb ram?
Problem is it only shows 4gb ram although I have 8gb
does your bios show that it recognizes all the ram?
yes. And it dual boots into vista 64 bit and shows 8 gb
Can we see your "uname -a" ?
and "free -m" ?
try "free -m |grep -i mem" for one line :-P
any ideas? I'm puzzled
yea i was looking around... seems odd. one sec
can you pastebin "sudo dmidecode|head -n 300"
sorry that's a lot of stuff, just looking towards the top where it shows the memory slots
http://www.peope.net/tmp.txt
I'm stumped.  your memory is recognized.  what does "top" show?  what first gave you the impression the OS wasn't showing you had 8gb of ram?
Mem:   4051180k total,  2417016k used,  1634164k free,   128540k buffers
you booted from the same kernel right?
I think so... but it would be logical if I didn't.
yea.  I cannot rationalize why, given what you told us before, it wasn't working
that is comforting at least :)
maybe its time to go play the lottery :-p
lol
